<div class="welcome-doc">
<h1>Hello, welcome to Visual Studio Code!</h1>

Here are four things you should know before getting started:

<div class="tips">
    <div class="tip">
        <div class="image quickopen"></div>
	    <div class="content">
		    <h3>Quick Open</h3>
		    <p>Find a file or symbol with **Ctrl+O**. To see your navigation history, use **Ctrl+Tab**.</p>
		</div>
    </div>
	<div class="tip">
        <div class="image sidebyside"></div>
		<div class="content">
		    <h3>Side by side editing</h3>
			<p>View files side-by-side using **Ctrl+Click** on the file name.  You can also find this command on the editor toolbar.</p>
		</div>
	</div>
	<div class="tip">
	    <div class="image workingfiles"></div>
		<div class="content">
	        <h3>Organize files</h3>
		    <p>Use **Working Files** to organize your work.  To add to the set, either make an edit or double-click the file name.</p>
		</div>
    </div>
	<div class="tip">
		<div class="image commandpalette"></div>
		<div class="content">
		    <h3>Command palette</h3>
		    <p>You can browse through all the commands with **Ctrl+Shift+P**.</p>
		</div>
    </div>
</div>

Now, to get started, open a folder with **File > Open...**

If you don't have an existing project, we suggest using [Yeoman](http://yeoman.io/ "Link to Yeoman") to scaffold out a new one.

<div class="getting-started">
## Getting Started
* [Developing with ASP.NET 5](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=533692 "Developing with ASP.NET 5")
* [Developing with Node.js](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=533693 "Developing with Node.js")
* [Debugging your application](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=533694 "Debugging your application")
